Uses of Interface
org.fishwife.jrugged.ServiceWrapper

  • Packages that use ServiceWrapper 
    Package Description
    org.fishwife.jrugged
    Provides for straightforward add-ons to existing code to make it more robust and easier to manage.

    • Uses of ServiceWrapper in org.fishwife.jrugged

      Classes in org.fishwife.jrugged that implement ServiceWrapper 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CircuitBreaker
      A CircuitBreaker can be used with a service to throttle traffic to a failed subsystem (particularly one we might not be able to monitor, such as a peer system which must be accessed over the network).
      class  ConstantFlowRegulator 
      class  LatencyTracker
      This is a statistics wrapper that records the latency of requests, both for successes and failures.
      class  PerformanceMonitor
      The PerformanceMonitor is a convenience wrapper for gathering a slew of useful operational metrics about a service, including moving averages for latency and request rate over various time windows (last minute, last hour, last day).
      class  RequestCounter
      This is a statistics wrapper that counts total requests, as well as how many succeed and how many fail.
      class  ServiceRetrier
      Calls a service multiple times until the call succeeds or the maximum number of tries is exceeded.
      class  ServiceWrapperChain 
      Methods in org.fishwife.jrugged that return ServiceWrapper 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ServiceWrapper ServiceWrapperFactory.getWrapperWithName(String name)
      Create a new ServiceWrapper using the given (presumed unique) identifier.
      Constructor parameters in org.fishwife.jrugged with type arguments of type ServiceWrapper 
      Constructor and Description
      ServiceWrapperChain(Collection<ServiceWrapper> wrappers)
